title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics center Nikola Vucevic contributed 19 points, 11 rebounds, aiding in a 124-105 victory over the Bulls before the All-Star break.
Jordan Walsh impressed with 16 points, six rebounds, and strong defensive play as the Celtics dominated the Bulls.
Former Celtic Anfernee Simons expressed openness to a future return to Boston, praising Vucevic's impact on the team.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Seamus Culleton, an Irish man married to a US citizen, has been detained by ICE for overstaying his visa.
Culleton, detained after a visit to Home Depot, describes poor conditions at the Texas ICE facility as 'hell on earth'.
Culleton's bail was rescinded despite a pending green card application, and his lawyer disputes the validity of documents used against him.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs recorded over 1,000 receiving yards for the Patriots in 2025, a feat last achieved by Julian Edelman in 2019.
Diggs' contract with a $20.6 million base salary in 2026 isn't fully guaranteed, potentially saving Patriots $20.8 million if released post-June 1.
Diggs, facing legal issues, maintains team support; QB Drake Maye emphasizes Diggs' impactful 2025 performance and offseason recovery opportunities.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard police and fire crews rescued a dog from icy waters at Mill Pond late Tuesday night.
The rescue operation was aided by a drone that guided firefighters to the stranded dog, Rufus.
Rufus was safely retrieved within ten minutes and returned home uninjured, said Fire Chief Angela Lawless.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues on Wednesday caused delays up to 50 minutes and more than 25 train cancellations on 12 commuter rail lines.
The Blue Line experienced a power issue, requiring shuttle service from Orient Heights to Wonderland due to track problems.
Normal service on the Blue Line resumed Wednesday evening after the power issue was resolved, according to the MBTA.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Former Worcester councilor Etel Haxhiaj was found guilty of assaulting a police officer, receiving six months probation.
Haxhiaj was acquitted of interfering with an officer during a 2025 immigration arrest involving Worcester police and ICE agents.
The arrest incident sparked protests, and Haxhiaj's lawyer criticized ICE's actions and argued her client acted in self-defense.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue will open its new BlueHouse BOS lounge at Logan Airport's Terminal C near gate C23 this summer.
The 11,000-square-foot lounge will feature Boston-themed art, design, food options, and experiences, and offer residential amenities.
The Boston lounge is nearly 40% larger than the JFK lounge and will include complimentary food, beverages, and private workspaces.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN's Field Yates predicts the Patriots will select Utah offensive tackle Caleb Lomu in the 2026 NFL Draft.
The Patriots need offensive line reinforcements after allowing 6 sacks in their Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
Coach Mike Vrabel supports keeping Will Campbell at left tackle despite mock drafts suggesting the need for improvements.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin aims to model his game after former Red Sox MVP Dustin Pedroia.
Durbin's low strikeout rate and strong defense make him a promising addition to Red Sox infield.
Acquired in a trade with the Brewers, Durbin is focusing on increasing his power at Fenway Park.

title: Jaylen Brown offers Drake Maye advice on how to ‘level up’ after  championship heartbreak
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown advises Patriots QB Drake Maye to use Super Bowl loss as motivation for future successes.
Brown reflects on his own championship losses, including the 2022 NBA Finals, and how he turned them into growth opportunities.
Brown suggests finding mental peace, sharing that playing the harp helped him post-loss, encouraging Maye to find his equivalent.
